Key Arguments: The legislation grants excessive power to public servants and the government, enabling censorship of information.
There is a lack of transparency regarding who decides what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The bill could be exploited by the government to advance political and social agendas.
The proposed fines are seen as a way for the government to profit from censorship.
The legislation could lead to self-censorship and restrict freedom of speech.
Notable Quotes: I believe this Bill enables the placement of an extraordinary and dangerous level of power into the hands of public servants.
Part 2, Division 4 reads like an Orwellian commitment to public naming and shaming.
These amendments pose a clear danger to our fundamental right to freedom of expression and freedom of speech.
